result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shawn Michael Songetay

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Waiver of Prelim on November 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:08 AM Cases 22CF134, 2022CF000177, 2022CF000181, 2022CF000201, 2022CM000093, and 2022CM000153 called together.  Defendant Shawn Michael Songetay in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Shawn Michael Songetay.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 22CF134 and 22CF181 on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of Informations, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Case 22CM153 on for an Initial Appearance.  Atty Chapman has not yet been appointed to that case.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Def enters NG plea.  Atty Chapman notes prelim in 22CF201 likely to be waived, and a global resolution has likely been reached, with restitution of $108 and probation anticipated.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on October 6, 2022 at 10:45 am.

2:31 PM Court calls cases, 22CF134 and 22CF181 set for ARGN, 22CF201 for PH, 22CF177 & 22CM93 for STC and 22CM153 for INIT.  Defendant Shawn Michael Songetay not in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman appeared by video for Shawn Michael Songetay.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attny Chapman has not been able to reach def, phone has been disconnected since before our last hearing.  ADA checks the other courtroom.  Def has failed to appear by any means.  State notes that officer is not able to appear today.  State willing to reschedule or issue and stay a warrant.  Attny doesn't have a phone number for def.  Court will reschedule and mail notice to def at address on file.  Will continue with Oct 6th at 10:45am with Judge Mogen as previously scheduled.  Status Conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 10:45am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
2:06 PM Called 22CF134, 22CF177, 22CF181 set for PH's, 22CF201 and 22CM153 for INIT's, and 22CM93 for STC.  Defendant Shawn Michael Songetay not in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Shawn Michael Songetay.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attny Chapman not attny of record on 22CM153.  Attny Chapman does not make a statement.  State requests warrant, Court issue in CM's WA body only statewide, in CF's body only in MN & WI.  Def appears at 2:08pm.  Off the record at 2:08pm. Back on the record at 2:10pm.  Warrants will not be issued as def has appeared in person.  Same appearances for Attny & State.  Attny Chapman confirms today will be 3 PH's.  Case 22CF201 on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Bond already set, bond continues. Attny Chapman will Waive Time limits on PH.  Set for 9-15-22 at 2:30pm with Commissioner for PH and INIT for 22CM153 as they have not received criminal complaint.  Copy given in court by clerk.  3 cases on for PH.  22CF134 is on for preliminary hearing.  State calls first witness, Officer Katelyn Barker, who is sworn in and testifies. All three cases have the same witness for the State, no objection for witness to stay on the stand. Witness asks to refresh her recollection from a report, State reviews report with Attny Chapman, witness refreshes recollection.  Officer continues testifying.  Witness has identified the defendant.  Venue is made.  Attny Chapman cross examines Officer Barker.  State has no re-direct.  Officer had body cam on during the incident.  Officer confirms identification, Attny Chapman has no issue with identification.  Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and the defendant probably committed it.  The matter is bound over for further proceedings.  The State efiles information.   Case 22CF177 is on for preliminary hearing.  State calls first witness, Officer Katelyn Barker, who is still sworn in and testifies. Attny Chapman stipulates to Officer Barkers training and experience for remaining cases today. Witness has identified the defendant.  Venue is made. Attny Chapman cross examines Officer Barker.  State objects.  Attny Chapman redirects.  Attny Chapman withdraws question, no more questions. State provides argument for contact with a no contact in place, no argument on obstruction.  Court doesn't find probable cause that a felony was committed. Attny Chapman enters NG plea on misdemeanor, count 3.  Court doesn't see a felony on this case.  Bond signed on June 1st 2022 and no contact with AS, offer of proof from Attny Chapman.  Not only reason for the court to not find felony charges.  Case 22CF181 is on for preliminary hearing.  State calls first witness, Officer Katlyn Barker, who is still sworn in and testifies.  No further questions from the State, no questions from Attny Chapman.  State asks court to take judicial notice of Bond in 22CF134, no objection.  Witness has identified the defendant.  Venue is made.  Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and the defendant probably committed it.  The matter is bound over for further proceedings.  The State files information.  Set ARGN on 9-15-2022 at 2:30pm with Commissioner and STC on 10-6-2022 at 10:45am with Judge.
Preliminary Hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.  Did NOT give to def, reset with Commissioner.

Defendant shall post $750 additional cash to be released from custody, for a total of $2,000 cash bond to be posted to cover Burnett County cases 22CF177, 22CM93, 22CF134, 22CF181, and 22GF226. The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.  Subject to random testing of breath, blood or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion.  No contact with "A.S."
